result.execSummary:
The defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Arm Self w/ Dangerous Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(2)(b).
  • Felon Possess Firearm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration Program AFTER serving 2 years.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to the Wood County case.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay costs.  Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Not to have any contact with Eugene Feist nor be upon the premises where he resides.   
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit DNA sample if one has not already been submitted.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to the Wood County case.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: of Sentencing Hearing on 03-25-15

Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:36 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Court and both counsel have received the PSI.  
Victim is not present today.  Written statement was received by the Court. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Atty McFarland makes clarification to the PSI on Page 5. 

Atty Cousins makes clarification to the PSI on Page 2.  Makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty McFarland makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Court questions parties re: programs. 
Court questions Atty McFarland re: credit. 
Court reviews the file. 
Atty McFarland notifies the Court that the defendant's father is in court and would like to speak. 
Court notes he would need to be called as a witness and the matter would then need to be adjourned. 
Atty McFarland wishes to continue. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 - 
7 years Prison with 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to the Wood County case. 
Count 4 - 
7 years Prison with 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 4 years Extended Supervision, concurrent with Count 1 but consecutive to the Wood County case.  
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration programs AFTER serving 2 years. 
No credit due to consecutive. 
Conditions:
Not to have any contact with Eugene Feist nor be upon the premises where he resides. 
Pay restitution of $2,825.00.
Pay costs on each count. Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 
Submit DNA sample if one has not already been submitted. 
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 

Defendant is provided with a copy of the Written Explanation. 
Court advises of post conviction 20 days.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on March 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in court with attorney Erik John Mcfarland. Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

11:37 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - DRI
Count 4 - No contest
Count 5 - DRI
Count 6 - DRI
Count 7 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Victim notification had been given; no victim's appear at today's plea hearing to make a statement.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 & 4 all other counts are DRI.  
Court will accept an updated PSI as one had been completed 14 months ago in Wood County.

BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered 
PSI to be completed by March 14, 2015 and copies forwarded to counsel
Bond continued  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 11:30 am.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus

records.addlTxt: Plea hearing on December 23, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Permitting Attorney (Raabe) to Withdraw from Representation of Defendant. 10/3/14 TTF
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cousins indicates there is no longer a plea agreement.  
Atty Raabe concurs.  Defendant no longer wishes to plead and moves to withdraw as counsel at the defendant's wishes. 
Court questions Defendant re: withdrawal.  
Defendant is in Green Bay Correctional for another year. 

Atty Cousins indicates he will revoke any plea offer made. 

BY THE COURT: 
Atty Raabe to prepare the Order for withdrawal and send to the Public Defender to appoint new counsel.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Petition for writ of habeas corpus

records.addlTxt: Arraignment on April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Thaddeus J Carroll-Femyer in court, in custody  Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Cousins indicates it is his understanding that a written waiver was filed by Atty Raabe. 

Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond Continued.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 10:00 am.
and Writ of Habeas Corpus
